As !NautilusSvn is under active development it's advised to keep track of [http://groups.google.com/group/nautilussvn/ the mailing list] and/or the [http://cobradragon.com/nautilussvn/ blog].

== Official releases ==

  _*There are no official releases as of yet*_

== Latest beta release ==

  <font color="#00F">_*NOTE: the latest beta release is v0.12-beta1 (16 march 2009)*_</font>

  <font color="#f00">_*README: for some users emblems are not being displayed after installing, if so please execute: `sudo gtk-update-icon-cache /usr/share/icons/hicolor/`. We'll update the Debian package and the setup script ASAP to do this automatically.*_</font> (thanks to darkstar6262 for letting us know this, see [http://code.google.com/p/nautilussvn/issues/detail?id=87 Issue #87])

Installing the NautilusSvn beta release is currently the easiest for users of Ubuntu (specifically Intrepid Ibex, or 8.10), however we've written up extensive installation instructions for users of other Linux distros.

<td>[http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/files/nautilussvn_0.12-1ubuntu1_all.deb http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/media/ubuntu.png]</td>
<td>
*Debian package for Ubuntu 8.10*

[http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/files/nautilussvn_0.12-1ubuntu1_all.deb Download this] if you are running Ubuntu, no need to follow any instructions.
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>[http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/files/nautilussvn_0.12-beta1.tar.gz http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/media/tarball.png]</td>
<td>
*Tarball for manual installation*

[http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/files/nautilussvn_0.12-beta1.tar.gz Download this] if you are running another distro. Follow the [http://code.google.com/p/nautilussvn/wiki/v012_Installation manual installation instructions].
</td>
</tr>
</table>

Be sure to restart Nautilus (nautilus -q && nautilus &) for NautilusSvn to get loaded.

== Development snapshots ==

Currently we're regularly creating snapshots of our development version (trunk). We consider these snapshots stable enough for actual usage, heck we personally run trunk and have yet to lose any precious modifications `*knocks on wood*` ;-).
